title: Old Speck Mountain
text:
Old Speck Mountain, also known as Old Speckle Mountain, is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located in <a href="Oxford%20County%2C%20Maine">Oxford County</a>, <a href="Maine">Maine</a>, United States. The mountain, the fourth-highest in the state, is the northeasternmost and highest of the <a href="Mahoosuc%20Range">Mahoosuc Range</a>, the northeasternmost part of the <a href="White%20Mountains%20%28New%20Hampshire%29">White Mountains</a>. Old Speck is flanked to the southwest by Mahoosuc Arm, and faces <a href="Baldpate%20Mountain%20%28Maine%29">Baldpate Mountain</a> to the northeast across <a href="Grafton%20Notch">Grafton Notch</a>.
Old Speck is within the <a href="drainage%20basin">watershed</a> of the <a href="Androscoggin%20River">Androscoggin River</a>, which drains into <a href="Merrymeeting%20Bay">Merrymeeting Bay</a>, the <a href="estuary">estuary</a> of the <a href="Kennebec%20River">Kennebec River</a>, and then into the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Maine">Gulf of Maine</a>. The north and east faces of Old Speck drain into the <a href="Bear%20River%20%28Androscoggin%20River%29">Bear River</a>, then into the Androscoggin. The southeast and southwest faces drain into the Bull Branch of Goose Eye Brook, then into the <a href="Sunday%20River%20%28Androscoggin%20River%29">Sunday River</a> and the Androscoggin. The northwest face drains into Silver Stream, then into <a href="Chickwolnepy%20Stream">Chickwolnepy Stream</a> and the Androscoggin.
The summit of Old Speck is on the southern boundary of <a href="Grafton%20Notch%20State%20Park">Grafton Notch State Park</a>. The <a href="Appalachian%20Trail">Appalachian Trail</a>, a <a href="National%20Scenic%20Trail">National Scenic Trail</a> from <a href="Georgia%20%28U.S.%20state%29">Georgia</a> to <a href="Maine">Maine</a>, runs along the Mahoosuc Range, west of the summit of Old Speck. A short side trail runs from the Appalachian Trail to the summit of the mountain. Speck Pond is located below the mountain's summit, at , it is stocked with <a href="brook%20trout">brook trout</a>. The Appalachian Trail descends from a location near the summit of Old Speck Mountain to the pond.
